DataElement.preferredName: Disease Response International Myeloma Working Group Minimal Residual Disease Criteria Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Categorization of response to treatment for minimal residual disease (MRD) based on criteria created by the International Myeloma Working Group (IMWG).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Response International Myeloma Working Group Minimal Residual Disease Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression._Uniform consensus criteria created by the International Myeloma Working Group to describe response to treatment for minimal residual disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: In medicine, an improvement related to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Property.preferredName: International Myeloma Working Group Minimal Residual Disease Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Uniform consensus criteria created by the International Myeloma Working Group to describe response to treatment for minimal residual disease.

Concepts.longName: International Myeloma Working Group Minimal Residual Disease Criteria
Concepts.definition: Uniform consensus criteria created by the International Myeloma Working Group to describe response to treatment for minimal residual disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NCI-INC0371350-19C0078 IMWG curation 4.19.19 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Minimal residual disease negativity as defined by next-generation flow cytometry or next-generation sequencing plus disappearance of every area of increased tracer uptake found at baseline or a preceding PET/CT or decrease to less mediastinal blood pool standard uptake value or decrease to less than that of surrounding normal tissue.

Concepts.definition: Minimal residual disease negativity as defined by next-generation flow cytometry or next-generation sequencing plus disappearance of every area of increased tracer uptake found at baseline or a preceding PET/CT or decrease to less mediastinal blood pool standard uptake value or decrease to less than that of surrounding normal tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Absence of clonal plasma cells by next-generation sequencing on bone marrow aspirate in which presence of a clone is defined as less than two identical sequencing reads obtained after DNA sequencing of bone marrow aspirates using the LymphoSIGHT platform (or validated equivalent method) with a minimum sensitivity of 1 in 10^5 nucleated cells or higher.

Concepts.definition: Absence of clonal plasma cells by next-generation sequencing on bone marrow aspirate in which presence of a clone is defined as less than two identical sequencing reads obtained after DNA sequencing of bone marrow aspirates using the LymphoSIGHT platform (or validated equivalent method) with a minimum sensitivity of 1 in 10^5 nucleated cells or higher.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Absence of phenotypically aberrant clonal plasma cells by next-generation flow cytometry on bone marrow aspirates using the EuroFlow standard operation procedure for minimal residual disease detection in multiple myeloma (or validated equivalent method) with a minimum sensitivity of 1 in 10^5 nucleated cells or higher.

Concepts.definition: Absence of phenotypically aberrant clonal plasma cells by next-generation flow cytometry on bone marrow aspirates using the EuroFlow standard operation procedure for minimal residual disease detection in multiple myeloma (or validated equivalent method) with a minimum sensitivity of 1 in 10^5 nucleated cells or higher.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Minimal residual disease negativity in the marrow, by next-generation flow cytometry or next-generation sequencing, or both, and by imaging, confirmed a minimum of 1 year apart.

Concepts.definition: Minimal residual disease negativity in the marrow, by next-generation flow cytometry or next-generation sequencing, or both, and by imaging, confirmed a minimum of 1 year apart.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for NCI-INC0371350-19C0078 IMWG curation 4.19.19 mc

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for NCI-INC0371350-19C0078 IMWG curation 4.19.19 mc
